results.title: The Ultimate skills
results.creator_credit: Tony Hansen, Timothy Read, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Three motor cycle champions, Warren Willing, road riding, Mick Andrews, trials riding, and Trevor Flood, motor cross, explain and demonstrate their skills and techniques. Commentary by Peter Gwynne.

results.title: Visibility and protective clothing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycling”
Examines the problems many motorists have in seeing motorcyclists, due to poor visibility from cars. Demonstrates the importance of protective clothing, the selection of the correct helmet, footgear, and gloves. Some riders talk about their accidents and injuries they have received.

results.title: Defensive riding techniques
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Defensive riding is avoiding accidents by foreseeing possible dangers and taking appropriate action. Gives three short rules: firstly, try to anticipate and, therefore, avoid mistakes of other motorists; secondly, drive defensively, and heed all traffic rules and signals; thirdly, make sure you can be seen at all times.

results.title: Basic riding techniques
results.creator_credit: Tony Hansen, Peter Johnson, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Peter Wherrett and Jenny Johnson discuss why a learner should begin on a 250cc bike. Looks at instruments and controls and explains their application and proper usage. Recommends the best clothing and gear to wear for comfort and safety.

results.title: Basic instinct (E)
results.creator_credit: Paul Verhoeven, Alan Marshall, Studio Canal+ and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Destined to become a modern classic, Paul Verhoeven’s effort has brought new definition and brilliance to the “femme fatale” of the film noir genre. It is all here, temptation, sex and murder, and all in the guise of a voluptuous beautiful woman. Michael Douglas plays an ex-undercover cop, burnt out and recovering from drug and alcohol addiction when he becomes involved with the investigation of a brutal murder. The prime suspect is a very rich, very beautiful young woman (Sharon Stone) who’s calm and collected exterior belies a predatory and hedonistic soul. Shocking, controversial and explicit, this is not a film for the squeamish. Co-starring George Dzundza.

results.title: Barton Fink
results.creator_credit: Joel Coen, Ethan Coen and Circle Films
results.brief_description: New York City, 1941. Barton Fink is a successful Hollywood writer who has come to the land of the rich and famous to make it big in the movies. However, now that Hollywood has embraced him, he finds himself suffering from a severe case of writer’s block, has a movie mogul with a passion for wrestling breathing down his neck, and an insane insurance salesman wanting to separate his head from his neck. An enormously amusing crackpot view of the underside of the Hollywood dream and a wonderful, if slightly bizarre, investigation of the creative mind in turmoil. Cast includes John Turturro, John Goodman, Judy Davis, Michael Lerner and John Mahoney.

results.title: Bartleby
results.brief_description:
An adaptation of Herman Melville’s story about Bartleby, the scrivener, who answers an advertisement for work with a lawyer and after a brief spurt of intense work, gradually breaks down, refuses to move, and eventually dies because he has lost the will to live.

Credits: Director, Maurice Ronet ; writers, Yvan Bostel, Maurice Ronet, Jacques Quoirez ; photography, Claude Robin ; music, Gerard Anfosso.
Cast: Michel Lonsdale, Maxence Mailfort, Maurice Biraud, Dominique Zardi, Jacques Fontanelle.
